DOC.brief_summary: Objectives : The primary objective trial determine effect aerobic exercise training ( AET ) change quality life ( QoL ) lymphoma survivor receive receive chemotherapy . Secondary objective determine effect AET change psychosocial outcome , cardiopulmonary fitness , body composition , treatment completion rate .

Participants : Participants 120 lymphoma survivor diagnose either non-Hodgkin 's lymphoma ( NHL ) Hodgkin 's disease ( HD ) receive receive least 8 week chemotherapy Cross Cancer Institute Edmonton , Alberta . Participants stratify disease type ( indolent NHL versus aggressive NHL versus HD ) plan chemotherapy protocol ( chemotherapy versus < 16 week versus > 16 week ) , randomly assign either 12 week exercise program usual care . Eligibility : Participants recruit Cross Cancer Institute . The eligibility criterion include medical , demographic , logistic criterion , focus internal validity well external validity . All individual interested participate study : ( ) ask provide inform consent , ( b ) complete self administer questionnaire , ( c ) schedule maximal physical fitness test , dual-x-ray absorptiometry ( DEXA ) scan , blood draw . The physical fitness test determine final eligibility study .
